What is the SPoRT ADAS?
What is the SPoRT ADAS?

• Blends surface data into a coherent analysis using ADAS:
• Blends surface data into a coherent analysis using ADAS:

• Strength in analyzing asynoptic data sets
• Strength in analyzing asynoptic data sets

13-km, 2-h RUC forecast as first-guess
13-km, 2-h RUC forecast as first-guess

• METAR, buoy, Mesonet, SAO
• METAR, buoy, Mesonet, SAO

• An observation is rejected if it is:
• An observation is rejected if it is:

significantly different than neighbors
significantly different than neighbors

greatly different than first-guess
greatly different than first-guess

blacklisted (user-defined)
blacklisted (user-defined)

• 2-km resolution captures mesoscale features
• 2-km resolution captures mesoscale features

• Assimilates observations from ±15 minutes from the top of every hour
• Assimilates observations from ±15 minutes from the top of every hour

• Available in AWIPS at 40-45 minutes past every hour
• Available in AWIPS at 40-45 minutes past every hour

SPoRT ADAS Uses
SPoRT ADAS Uses

• Provides an additional high-resolution surface analysis for:
• Provides an additional high-resolution surface analysis for:

real-time meso-analysis
real-time meso-analysis

initializing grids within gridded forecasts
initializing grids within gridded forecasts

verification of gridded forecasts
verification of gridded forecasts

• Similar to:
• Similar to:

• SPoRT ADAS has been most useful in forecasting nighttime
• SPoRT ADAS has been most useful in forecasting nighttime

temperatures in the elevated regions of NE AL
temperatures in the elevated regions of NE AL

Accessing the SPoRT ADAS in AWIPS
Accessing the SPoRT ADAS in AWIPS

• Located under the “Volume”
• Located under the “Volume”

tab on the menu
tab on the menu

• Click on “Browser”
• Click on “Browser”

• Product appears as “ADAS”
• Product appears as “ADAS”

• Variables available:
• Variables available:

2-m temperature
2-m temperature

2-m relative humidity
2-m relative humidity

10-m winds
10-m winds

other variables derived from T and RH
other variables derived from
T and RH

Surface Temperature Comparison
Surface Temperature Comparison

• Neither analysis shows obvious bulls eyes due to quality control issues
• Neither analysis shows obvious
bulls eyes due to quality control
issues

• One case—may have been no questionable observations
• One case—may have been no
questionable observations

• Better resolution of SPoRT ADAS allows it to pick up sharper gradients
• Better resolution of SPoRT
ADAS allows it to pick up
sharper gradients

• Especially evident in the higher terrain of eastern Alabama and western Georgia
• Especially evident in the higher
terrain of eastern Alabama and
western Georgia

LAPS SPoRT ADAS
LAPS
SPoRT ADAS

Surface Temperature in High Terrain
Surface Temperature in High Terrain

SPoRT ADAS depicts tight gradients associated with terrain features much better than LAPS
SPoRT ADAS depicts tight gradients associated with terrain features much better
than LAPS

transitioning unique NASA data and research technologies to the NWS

Errors and Error Reporting
Errors and Error Reporting

If the file has not arrived by 50 past the hour, there has either been an error in the analysis process or in the transfer of the data from NASA to NWS
If the file has not arrived by 50 past the hour, there has either been an
error in the analysis process or in the transfer of the data from NASA to
NWS

• Analyses may occasionally be missing due to unavailable RUC files,
• Analyses may occasionally be missing due to unavailable RUC files,

missing observation files, or corrupted observation files
missing observation files, or corrupted observation files

• Outages due to errors in the analysis process may last for several
• Outages due to errors in the analysis process may last for several

consecutive hours
consecutive hours

• Contact SPoRT Liaisons Geoffrey Stano and/or Kevin Fuell if a data
• Contact SPoRT Liaisons Geoffrey Stano and/or Kevin Fuell if a data

outage occurs for more than a half day
outage occurs for more than a half day

transitioning unique NASA data and research technologies to the NWS
transitioning unique NASA data and research technologies to the NWS

Summary
Summary

• SPoRT ADAS uses good quality control and 2-km resolution to pick up fine-scale features not seen in other surface analyses available in AWIPS
• SPoRT ADAS uses good quality control and 2-km resolution to pick up
fine-scale features not seen in other surface analyses available in f i n e - s c a l e

• SPoRT ADAS has proven most useful for nighttime temperature over
• SPoRT ADAS has proven most useful for nighttime temperature over

elevated terrain in eastern edge of HUN forecast region
elevated terrain in eastern edge of HUN forecast region

• Let’s work together to analyze this product: feedback on where/when SPoRT ADAS provides better analysis than other available analyses
